trait.name: Orc Hunter
entries: Ruiniel has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track Orcs and Goblinoids, and on Intelligence ({@skill Nature}) checks to recall information about any of the forces of Sauron.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Ruiniel has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put her to sleep.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: Ruiniel has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: War Archery
entries: A longbow deals one extra die of its damage when Ruiniel hits with it (included in the attack). In addition, when Ruiniel makes a ranged attack with a longbow, it doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll from being within 5 feet of a hostile creature, though it may still have disadvantage from other sources.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ruiniel makes two Shortsword attacks or two Longbow attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. Instead of dealing damage, Ruiniel can pin part of the target's clothing or body to the ground or to a nearby wall or tree. If it does so, the target is {@condition restrained}. A creature, including the target, can take its action to remove the arrow and free the {@condition restrained} target by succeeding on a {@dc 14} Strength check.

trait.name: Brutal Critical
entries: If the barbarian scores a critical hit, it rolls its damage dice four times, instead of twice.

trait.name: Feral Instinct
entries: If the barbarian isn't {@condition unconscious}, it can't be surprised and has advantage on initiative rolls.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The barbarian's weapon attacks are magical and deal one additional die of damage on a hit (included in the attack).

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the barbarian can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the barbarian takes damage that reduces it to 0 hit points without being killed outright, it can choose to fall to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While not wearing armor, the barbarian's AC includes its Constitution modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The berserker makes three melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage, or 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

trait.name: Brutal Critical
entries: If the barbarian scores a critical hit, it rolls its damage dice three times, instead of twice.

trait.name: Feral Instinct
entries: If the barbarian isn't {@condition unconscious}, it can't be surprised and has advantage on initiative rolls.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the barbarian can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While not wearing armor, the barbarian's AC includes its Constitution modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The berserker makes two melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

trait.name: Brutal Critical
entries: If the barbarian scores a critical hit, it rolls its damage dice five times, instead of twice.

trait.name: Feral Instinct
entries: If the barbarian isn't {@condition unconscious}, it can't be surprised and has advantage on initiative rolls.

trait.name: Indomitable Might

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The berserker makes four melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d12 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) piercing damage, or 16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The inheritor's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells innately:

trait.name: Ancestral Demise
entries: When the inheritor dies, it disintegrates and becomes an ancestral spirit, joining the other ancestral spirits as they pass on to guard one of the inheritor's children chosen at random. If the inheritor has no children, it dies, along with all of its ancestral spirits.

trait.name: Ancestral Protectors
entries: In battle, the inheritor is surrounded and protected by ancestral spirits, the souls of its ancestors. The first time the inheritor hits a creature with a melee weapon attack on its turn, the creature becomes the target of the ancestral spirits, hindering its attacks. The target has disadvantage on attacks rolls until the start of the inheritor's next turn.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the inheritor is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The inheritor makes two attacks with its greataxe.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Spirit Shield
entries: When a creature the inheritor can see within 30 feet of it takes damage from an attack, the inheritor can use its reaction to provide aid through its ancestral spirits, reducing the damage by 7 ({@dice 2d6}).

trait.name: Look at Me
entries: I'm the Chief Now. When the chief berserker is killed, one berserker ally within 30 feet of the berserker can magically and permanently adopt the chief berserker's statblock. The berserker ally retains its hit points and its equipment.

trait.name: Reckless Rally
entries: At the start of its turn, the chief berserker can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

Berserker allies within 30 feet of the berserker also have advantage on the first attack they make on their next turn against any creature the berserker attacked with its reckless trait active this turn.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While not wearing armor, the chief berserker's AC includes its Constitution modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chief berserker makes two attacks with its greataxe.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ripping berserker makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or use its reaction to make a melee attack against another creature of the berserker's choice it can see.

items.name: Spider Climb
entries: The berserker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 2d8 + 2d12 + 3}) piercing damage.

items.name: Amphibious
entries: The berserker can breathe air and water.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 2d12}) poison damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The apex predator can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The apex predator has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the apex predator can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The apex predator can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The apex predator makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 2d8 + 2d12 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or use its reaction to make a melee attack against another creature of the apex predator's choice it can see.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 2d12}) poison damage.

legendary.name: Claws
entries: The apex predator attacks with its claws.

legendary.name: Hunt
entries: The apex predator makes a Perception check.

resist.note: from attacks not made with silvered weapons

trait.name: Avatar's Luck
entries: The Prowler magically adds 5 ({@dice 2d4}) to the result of each attack roll, ability check, and saving throw he makes.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The Prowler has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks, and his passive Perception increases by 5.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: When the Prowler fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Prowler's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Packless
entries: The Prowler has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if the Prowler is the only creature within 5 feet of him.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: Once per target, when the Prowler surprises a creature and hits him with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage from the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Prowler makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage, and if the target is humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with lycanthropy (MM 207). The Prowler decides which kind of lycanthrope the target becomes (almost always a werewolf).

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

legendary.name: Hunt
entries: The Prowler moves up to his speed and takes the {@action Search} action.

legendary.name: Skulk
entries: The Prowler moves up to his speed and takes the {@action Hide} action.

legendary.name: Slash
entries: The Prowler makes an attack with his claws.

legendary.name: Bide (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Prowler regains all expended uses of his Legendary Resistance.

trait.name: Blood Points
entries: When the blood rager has taken more than 20 damage in the previous round, it chooses one of the following effects this turn:

items.name: Empowered Attack
items.entry: The blood rager adds an extra 10 damage to the first attack it hits with.

items.name: Empowered Senses
items.entry: Until the end of its turn, the blood rager can see {@condition invisible} creatures as if they were visible up to a range of 60 feet.

items.name: Empowered Speed
items.entry: Until the end of its turn, the blood rager's speed increases by 30 feet.

trait.name: Bloodshed Armor
entries: While the blood rager is not wearing armor, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the blood rager can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: The Smell of Blood
entries: The blood rager has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell to detect creatures that are at half their maximum hit points or fewer. Creatures up to 1 mile away smell as strongly to the blood rager as they would if they were only 5 feet away.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Blood Rager makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the kuldjargh can move up to its speed towards a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: The kuldjargh has advantage on saving throws to resist being {@condition poisoned}.

trait.name: Grappling Armor
entries: The kuldjargh can make a grapple check as a bonus action after it hits a creature with a weapon attack. The kuldjargh doesn't need a free hand to grapple.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the kuldjargh can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Spiked Armor
entries: A creature within 5 feet of the kuldjargh that hits it with a melee weapon attack takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage. Additionally, a creature grappling or {@condition grappled} by the kuldjargh takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage at the start of the kuldjargh's turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kuldjargh makes three melee weapon attacks: two with its handaxes and one with its spiked armor.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spiked Armor
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage. The kuldjargh doesn't need to roll an attack for a creature it is grappling.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the berserker is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage or 8 ({@dice 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Mercury Action
entries: The berserker rolls {@dice 1d6} and takes the corresponding action below.

items.name: Charge
items.entry: The berserker targets a creature it can see at minimum 20 feet from it and moves up to its speed towards it, then makes a battleaxe attack against it if in range. On a hit, the target takes an additional 11 ({@damage 2d10}) damage and, if the creature is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Escape
items.entry: The berserker takes the {@action Dodge}, {@action Disengage}, and {@action Dash} actions.

items.name: Flurry
items.entry: The berserker makes three attacks with its battleaxe.

items.name: Power Strike
items.entry: The berserker makes one battleaxe attack, and its to-hit bonus is {@hit 7}. On a hit, the berserker scores a critical hit.

items.name: Rejuvenate
items.entry: The berserker regains 10 hit points and gains 10 temporary hit points.

items.name: Teleport
items.entry: The berserker magically teleports up to 120 feet to an empty space that it can see. If it teleports to within 5 feet of a creature, it can then make one battleaxe attack against that creature.

variant.name: Alternative Actions
entries: Alternative actions are provided below. You can swap any of them out

items.name: Beast Shape.
items.entry: The berserker transforms into a beast of CR 1 or lower, usually a {@creature brown bear}. Its equipment melds into its new form and it retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as its hit points. It can immediately take one of the beast's actions. The berserker reverts to its original form when it is killed or at the beginning of its next turn.

items.name: Challenge.
items.entry: The berserker challenges a creature within 60 feet of it that can see and hear it. The target must make a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than the berserker, and it can't willingly move further away from the berserker. Whether the target succeeds or fails, the berserker can then make one attack.

items.name: Frighten.
items.entry: Each hostile creature within 30 feet of the berserker that can see and hear it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the berserker's next turn.

items.name: Grow.
items.entry: The berserker becomes a Large creature until the end of its next turn, gaining advantage on Strength saving throws and ability checks and a bonus {@damage 1d10} damage on its attacks. The berserker then makes one attack.

items.name: Rally.
items.entry: The berserker calls to two allies that can hear it. The targets can immediately use their reaction to make a weapon attack. If they do so, they have advantage on the attack roll.

items.name: Wild Magic Surge.
items.entry: The berserker rolls on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table, with the following changes. Any ongoing effects end after 1 minute or when the berserker dies.

items: A result of 21-22 instead refers to any effect originating that requires the target to make a saving throw.
A result of 27-28 instead allows the berserker to make one melee weapon attack as a bonus action each round.
A result of 33-34 instead maximises the damage of the next attack the berserker hits with.
A result of 59-60 or 99-100 instead replenishes all of the berserker's hit points.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The barbarian's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells innately, but only as a ritual.

trait.name: Totem of the Bear
entries: Hostile creatures within 5 feet of the barbarian that can see and hear it have disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than the barbarian.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The barbarian makes four attacks with its scimitars.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Totem of the Tiger
entries: The barbarian's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Totem of the Wolf (1/Turn)
entries: When the barbarian hits a Large or smaller creature with a melee weapon attack, it can choose to force the target to make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. The target falls {@condition prone} on a failed save.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the storm herald can move up to its speed towards a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Aura of the Sea
entries: Creatures that start their turn within 5 feet of the storm herald must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the storm herald can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.
Additionally, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}

items.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

items.name: Aura of the Desert
entries: Creatures that start their turn within 5 feet of the storm herald or hit the storm herald with a melee attack take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

items.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage. Additionally, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Aura of the Tundra
entries: Allied creatures that start their turn within 30 feet of the storm herald gain 3 ({@damage 1d6}) temporary hit points.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the berserker can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Wild Magic Initiative
entries: When the berserker rolls initiative, it rolls twice on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table and uses either result. If it rolls the same number twice, it can choose any result on the table.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The berserker makes two melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Wild Magic Reaction
entries: When the berserker takes damage, it rolls twice on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table and uses either result. If it rolls the same number twice, it can choose any result on the table.

trait.name: Beyond Death (2/Day)
entries: When the zealot is reduced to 0 hit points by an attack that isn't a critical hit, and the zealot is not killed outright, it can choose to fall to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: When the zealot fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the zealot can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zealot makes two attacks with Dawn Star.

action.name: Dawn Star
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Charisma saving throw or begin shedding bright light in a 10 foot radius and dim light for 10 feet beyond that. The glowing light grants advantage on attack rolls against the target, and it lasts until the start of the target's next turn. This is a magic weapon.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The one hit wonder is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following bard spells.

trait.name: Countercharm
entries: While playing music, the one hit wonder and allied creatures that can hear it within 30 feet of it have advantage on all saving throws and are immune to the {@condition frightened} and {@condition charmed} conditions.

trait.name: Bardic Inspiration (1/Turn)
entries: As a bonus action, the one hit wonder chooses an ally that can see and hear it within 30 feet of its position. In the next minute, the target can add {@dice 1d10} to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw of its choice. Once a target has benefited from this feature, it must finish a short or long rest before it can benefit from it again.

action.name: Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rock legend is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following bard spells.

trait.name: Countercharm
entries: While playing music, the rock legend and allied creatures that can hear it within 30 feet of it have advantage on all saving throws and are immune to the {@condition frightened} and {@condition charmed} conditions.

trait.name: Bardic Inspiration (1/Turn)
entries: As a bonus action, the rock legend chooses an ally that can see and hear it within 30 feet of its position. In the next minute, the target can add {@dice 1d12} to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw of its choice. Once a target has benefited from this feature, it must finish a short or long rest before it can benefit from it again.

action.name: Bardic Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage. This is a magic weapon. While attuned to this axe, the wielder's Charisma is increased by 2, potentially above the maximum of 20.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The blade is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following bard spells.

trait.name: Blade Flourish (1/Turn)
entries: When the blade hits with an attack on its turn, the blade can use one of the following options.

trait.name: Defensive Flourish
entries: The blade rolls {@dice 1d8} and adds the amount to the damage of its attack. It also adds this amount to its AC until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Mobile Flourish
entries: The blade rolls {@dice 1d8} and adds the amount to the damage of its attack. Additionally, the blade pushes its target 10 feet. The blade can then move up to its speed.

trait.name: Slashing Flourish
entries: The blade chooses a creature within 5 feet of its original target. Both targets take an additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blade makes three attacks with its scimitars.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The court debater is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following bard spells prepared.

trait.name: Facts Don't Care About Your Feelings (1/Day)
entries: After casting {@spell calm emotions}, the court debater regains a 2nd level spell slot. Creatures under the effects of {@spell calm emotions} cast by the court debater have disadvantage on concentration checks.

trait.name: Silence, Liberal (1/Day)
entries: After casting {@spell silence}, the court debater regains two 1st level spell slots.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The court debater attempts to own a liberal with facts and logic. It can then cast a spell.

action.name: Facts and Logic
entries: The court debater targets a creature it can see within 60 feet of it that can hear it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage and incur disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes before the end of the court debater's next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bard is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Song of Rest
entries: The bard can perform a song while taking a short rest. Any ally who hears the song regains an extra {@dice 1d6} hit points if it spends any Hit Dice to regain hit points at the end of that rest. The bard can confer this benefit on itself as well.

trait.name: Summon Note of Potential
entries: As a bonus action, the bard targets one ally within 30 feet of it that can hear the bard. A {@creature note of potential|OCLD} appears within 5 feet of the target and lives for up to one minute. The target becomes the note of potential's conductor. A creature can only be the conductor to one note of potential at a time.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Note of Potential
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Conductor-Bound
entries: The note of potential shares initiative with its conductor, can occupy its space, and can move up to 90 ft. outside of initiative order to always remain within 5 feet of the conductor.

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: The note of potential can't take actions, and it can only take reactions if it is within 5 feet of its conductor. After taking a reaction, or if it ends its turn further than 5 feet from its conductor, the note of potential is destroyed.

reaction.name: Note of Destruction
entries: When the conductor makes an attack roll, the note of potential emits a burst of sound.
Each creature within 5 feet of it that can hear it must must make a Constitution saving throw or take 4 ({@damage 1d8}) thunder damage.

reaction.name: Note of Ingenuity
entries: When the conductor makes an ability check, the note of potential grants it advantage on that check.

reaction.name: Note of Protection
entries: When the conductor takes damage, the note of potential grants it resistance to the damage of that attack.

monster.name: Dancing Item
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Endless Waltz
entries: Immediately after the dancing item makes a slam attack, it can take the {@action Dodge} action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The item is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

action.name: Force-Empowered Slam
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) force damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bard's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells innately:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bard is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following bard spells.

trait.name: Majesty
entries: The first time a creature attacks the bard on a turn, the attacker must make a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it can't attack the bard on this turn, and it must choose a new target for the attack or the attack is wasted.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The jester's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following bard spells.

trait.name: Light-Footed
entries: The jester has resistance to damage taken as a result of a fall.

trait.name: Tumbler
entries: As a bonus action, the jester can take both the {@action Dash} and {@action Disengage} actions.

action.name: Jester's Club
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage, and the target has disadvantage on the next ability check it makes before the end of its next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bard is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Song of Rest
entries: The bard can perform a song while taking a short rest. Any ally who hears the song regains an extra {@dice 1d6} hit points if it spends any Hit Dice to regain hit points at the end of that rest. The bard can confer this benefit on itself as well.

trait.name: Cutting Words
entries: When a creature the bard can see within 60 feet of it makes an attack roll, ability check, or damage roll, the bard subtracts 4 ({@dice 1d8}) from the result. This has no effect if the creature can't hear the bard or is immune to being {@condition charmed}.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Shadow Dancer
languages: usually including at least one from Abyssal

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dancer is an 8th-level spellcaster. The dancer's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following bard spells.

trait.name: Spreading Shadow
entries: When the dancer rolls initiative, it chooses itself and up to 3 allies within 60 feet of it. Creatures chosen by the dancer can move an additional 20 feet on their first turn as long as that movement is in dim light or darkness, and they can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on their first turn.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bard is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following bard spells.

trait.name: Song of Rest
entries: The bard can perform a song while taking a short rest. Any ally who hears the song regains an extra {@dice 1d6} hit points if it spends a Hit Dice to regain hit points at the end of that rest. The bard can confer this benefit on itself as well.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bard makes two attacks with its longsword.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Combat Inspiration
entries: When an attack roll is made against the bard or a friendly creature the bard can see within 60 feet of it, the bard can add 4 ({@dice 1d8}) to the target's AC against that attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bard is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following bard spells.

action.name: Intrusive Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Mantle of Whispers
entries: The bard dons a shadow it has captured through its Whispers of Death like a coat. The bard vanishes, magically transforming into a disguise of the person whose shadow the bard has captured. The bard takes on the appearance of the dead person, but healthy and alive. The disguise lasts for 1 hour until the bard ends it as a bonus action.

While in the disguise, the bard gains access to all information that the humanoid would freely share with a casual acquaintance and can easily pass as the person by drawing on its memories. Another creature can see through the disguise by succeeding on a {@dc 18} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.

reaction.name: Whispers of Death (Recharges on a Long Rest)
entries: When a humanoid dies within 30 feet of the bard, it can use its reaction to magically capture the humanoid's shadow.
The bard retains this shadow until it uses its Mantle of Whispers action or completes a long rest.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bishop is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Turn Undead (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The bishop presents its holy symbol and speaks a prayer. Each undead that can see or hear the bishop must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. If the target is an undead of CR 1 or lower, it is destroyed on a failed save. Otherwise, on a failed save the target is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

A turned creature moves up to its speed away from the bishop and can't willingly move within 30 feet of it. It can't take reactions and must either use the {@action Dash} action or try to escape from an effect that stops it from moving. If it can't move, it can take the {@action Dodge} action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cardinal is a 15th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Turn Undead (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The cardinal presents its holy symbol and speaks a prayer. Each undead that can see or hear the cardinal must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. If the target is an undead of CR 3 or lower, it is destroyed on a failed save. Otherwise, on a failed save the target is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

A turned creature moves up to its speed away from the cardinal and can't willingly move within 30 feet of it. It can't take reactions and must either use the {@action Dash} action or try to escape from an effect that stops it from moving. If it can't move, it can take the {@action Dodge} action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The avatar is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared.

trait.name: Divine Intervention (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the avatar can cast any spell with a casting time of one action from the cleric spell list without expending a spell slot or components, even if the spell isn't on its prepared spell list or if it has already cast a spell on its turn. After doing so, the avatar regains all of its expended spell slots.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Turn Undead (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The avatar presents its holy symbol and speaks a prayer. Each undead that can see or hear the avatar must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw. If the target is an undead of CR 4 or lower, it is destroyed on a failed save. Otherwise, on a failed save the target is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

A turned creature moves up to its speed away from the avatar and can't willingly move within 30 feet of it. It can't take reactions and must either use the {@action Dash} action or try to escape from an effect that stops it from moving. If it can't move, it can take the {@action Dodge} action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 6th-level spellcaster. It spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared.

trait.name: Spell Breaker
entries: When the priest restores hit points to an ally with a spell of 1st level or higher, it can also end one spell affecting that creature. The level of the spell ended must be equal to or lower than the level of the spell slot expended to heal the ally.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Abjure the Supernatural (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: One celestial, elemental, fey, or fiend the priest can see within 30 feet of it that can see and hear the priest must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} by the priest. While it is {@condition frightened}, it cannot take actions or reactions and must use its movement to move as far away from the priest as it can. The target can repeat the save at the end of its turn if the priest isn't in line of sight, ending the effect on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared.

trait.name: Morbid Weapons
entries: The priest's weapon attacks are magical. When the priest hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it deals an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

from: {@item +1 plate armor||Armor of the Divine Forge}

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells innately.

action.name: Hammer of the Divine Forge
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or ignite in flames. At the start of each of the target's turns, the target makes another Constitution saving throw, taking 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or ending the effect on a success. The effects end when the target or a creature within 5 feet of it uses an action to put out the flames, or if some other effect douses the flames. This is a +1 magic weapon.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared.
footerEntries: 1st Level (4 slots): bane, cure wounds, false life, healing word, inflict wounds, sanctuary
2nd Level (3 slots): blindness/deafness, feign death, gentle repose, lesser restoration
3rd Level (3 slots): ray of enfeeblement, revivify, speak with dead, vampiric touch

trait.name: Circle of Mortality
entries: When the priest would normally roll one or more dice to restore hit points with a spell to a creature at 0 hit points, it instead uses the highest number possible for each die.

action.name: Grave Scythe
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d12}) slashing damage.

action.name: Protect the Dying {@recharge 5}
entries: The priest chooses up to three {@condition unconscious} creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. The priest can choose to spend one spell slot of
1st level or higher; if it does so, each target regains 6 hit points. If the priest doesn't spend a spell slot, the targets are instead stabilised.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The priest can cast the following spells innately.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Preserve Life (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The priest targets up to six creatures it can see within 30 feet. The priest heals the targets, dividing up to 30 hit points between them.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Radiance of the Dawn {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature within 30 feet of the priest that can see it must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Charm Animals and Plants (Recharges After a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Each animal and plant within 30 feet of the priest that can see and hear it must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition charmed} by the priest until the end of its next turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared.

action.name: Moonlight Sickle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage, and the target is bathed in moonlight, granting advantage to the next attack roll made against it made before the end of the priest's next turn. This is a magic weapon.

action.name: Midnight Gloom {@recharge 5}
entries: All magical and nonmagical lights within 30 feet of the priest are extinguished. Each hostile creature within that radius must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage and can't benefit from darkvision for 1 minute. On a successful save, the target takes half damage instead and suffers no other effects.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared.

trait.name: Authoritative Strikes
entries: The priest's weapon attacks are magical and deal an additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) psychic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Voice of Authority
entries: Immediately after the priest targets an ally with a spell, the target can use its reaction to make a weapon attack against a creature the priest can see. If more than one ally is targeted, the priest chooses which ally can take this reaction.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Order's Demand
entries: Each creature of the priest's choice within 30 feet of the priest must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or immediately drop an item they are holding (priest's choice) and become {@condition charmed} by the priest until the end of the priest's next turn or until the {@condition charmed} creature takes damage. While {@condition charmed} in this way, a creature views the priest as the ultimate determiner of what is right and wrong.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Radiant Defense (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The priest chooses an ally it can see within 30 feet of it. The first time that creature is hit by an attack in the next minute, the attacker takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) radiant damage.

reaction.name: Protection
entries: When a creature attacks a target other than the priest within 30 feet of the priest, and the priest can see them both, the priest can move up to its speed. If it ends this movement within 5 feet of the target of the attack, the priest can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared.

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands to make a melee attack.

reaction.name: Thunderous Rebuke
entries: When a creature hits the priest with a melee weapon attack, the priest can force the creature to make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning or thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared.

action.name: Duplicitous Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage if the target can see the priest's illusion from Invoke Duplicity. This is a +1 magic weapon.

action.name: Cloak of Shadows (Recharge After a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The priest becomes {@condition invisible} until the end of its next turn, or until it casts a spell.

action.name: Invoke Duplicity
entries: The priest creates a perfect illusion of itself that lasts for 1 minute or until it loses its concentration, as if concentrating on a spell. The illusion appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of the priest. As a bonus action, the priest can move the illusion up to 30 feet to a space within 120 feet of the priest that it can see. Additionally, when both the priest and its illusion are within 5 feet of a creature that can see the illusion, the priest has advantage on attack rolls against that creature.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared.

spells: {@spell spiritual weapon} (an arrow, rushing with wind as if forever suspended in mid-flight)

trait.name: Brave
entries: The priest has advantage on saving throws to resist being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Stay in This Moment (1/Day)
entries: After casting {@spell sanctuary}, the priest regains a 1st level spell slot.

trait.name: Vigilance
entries: The priest and up to 6 allies have advantage on initiative rolls.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Arch Shepherd
languages: Druidic and Sylvan plus any one language

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The arch shepherd is an 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared.
footerEntries: 1st Level (4 slots): animal friendship, beast bond, speak with animals
2nd Level (3 slots): animal messenger, beast sense, enhance ability, locate animals or plants

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Animal Aura (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The arch shepherd chooses a point within 60 feet that it can see and calls forth an aura with a 30-foot radius around that point. The arch shepherd can move the aura up to 60 feet to a point it can see as a bonus action. The aura persists for 1 minute or until the arch shepherd is {@condition incapacitated}. The aura has one of the following effects:

action.name: Bear Aura
entries: Each creature in the aura when it appears gains 14 ({@dice 4d6}) temporary hit points and has advantage on Strength checks and saving throws while in the aura.

action.name: Hawk Aura
entries: When a creature in the aura makes an attack roll, the arch shepherd can use its reaction to grant advantage on that roll.

action.name: Unicorn Aura
entries: An allied creature that starts its turn in the aura gains 3 ({@dice 1d6}) hit points.
Before or after taking the Animal Aura action, the arch shepherd can cast a spell with a casting time of one action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The archdruid is an 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

action.name: Shillelagh Staff
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Change Shape (2/Day)
entries: The archdruid magically polymorphs into {@filter a beast or elemental with a challenge rating of 6 or less|bestiary|Challenge Rating=[&0;&6]|type=beast;elemental}, and can remain in this form for up to 10 hours. The archdruid can choose whether its equipment falls to the ground, melds with its new form, or is worn by the new form. The archdruid reverts to its true form if it dies or falls {@condition unconscious}. The archdruid can revert to its true form using a bonus action on its turn.

While in a new form, the archdruid retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, and Dexterity are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any special senses, proficiencies, traits, actions, and reactions (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks. It can cast its spells with verbal or somatic components in its new form (marked with an
asterisk*).
The new form's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunity to nonmagical attacks.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dream guardian is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared.

trait.name: Moonlight Hearth
entries: During a short or long rest, the dream guardian touches a point in space, and an invisible, 30-foot-radius sphere of magic appears, centered on that point. Total cover blocks the sphere.

While within the sphere, the dream guardian and its allies gain a +5 bonus to Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks, and any light from open flames in the sphere isn't visible outside of it. The sphere vanishes at the end of the rest or when the dream guardian leaves the sphere.

trait.name: Summer Balm (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the dream guardian blesses a creature it can see within 120 feet of it. The target regains 10 ({@dice 3d6}) hit points and 9 temporary hit points.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

monster.name: Wildfire Spirit
languages: understands the languages of its creator

action.name: Flame Seed
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/30 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) fire damage.

action.name: Fiery Teleportation {@recharge 5}
entries: The spirit teleports up to 30 feet to unoccupied spaces the spirit can see. Each creature within 10 feet of the space that the spirit left must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The flamefighter is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared.

trait.name: Binder of Fire Spirits
entries: Creatures killed by fire damage originating from the flamefighter burst into spectral flames upon death. These spectral flames immediately reconstitute into a {@creature wildfire spirit|OCLD} under the flamefighter's control.

action.name: Flamefighter Fan
entries: The flamefighter waves its fan. Each creature in a 10-foot cube originating from the flamefighter must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away. Objects up to 50 pounds are also pushed, and nonmagical fires are extinguished.

reaction.name: Fiery Teleportation
entries: When a {@creature wildfire spirit|OCLD} under the flamefighter's control uses its Fiery Teleportation, the flamefighter can also teleport to an unoccupied space within 30 feet of it that it can see.

action.name: Scurry
entries: The animated mouse takes the {@action Disengage} and {@action Hide} actions. It can break them up with movement.

monster.name: Growth Druid
languages: Druidic and Sylvan plus any one language

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The druid's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It can can cast the following spell innately.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The druid is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared.

trait.name: Floral Aura
entries: The druid and each allied creature within 30 feet of the druid that can smell it regains {@dice 1d4} hit points when it starts its turn in direct sunlight and isn't {@condition unconscious}.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Plant Shape (1/Day)
entries: The druid casts {@spell polymorph} on itself with the following changes: the druid can transform into a plant instead of a beast (usually an awakened tree), the druid does not need to concentrate on the spell, and the new form's attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances and immunities to nonmagical attacks.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sand shaman is a 6th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared.

action.name: Sickle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The druid is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared.

trait.name: Ritual Sacrifice
entries: When the druid reduces a creature to 0 hit points, that creature dies and the druid can immediately cast one of the following spells without material components, triggering its effects immediately. Once it has cast one of these ritual spells, it can't cast the same spell using this trait until it finishes a long rest. Wisdom is its spellcasting ability for these spells (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks).
Ritual Spells: {@spell augury}, {@spell commune with nature}, {@spell find familiar}, {@spell forbiddance} (deals necrotic damage and targets humanoids), {@spell meld into stone}, {@spell silence}

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Moon Druid Variant Change Shape
entries: To more accurately reflect the class feature, instead of the druid and each of its new shapes sharing the same pool of hit points like in the regular archdruid statblock, a moon druid gains the extra hit points of all of its new shapes, in addition to other benefits.

This allows a fight with the archdruid to naturally split into three stages. The fight can begin with the archdruid transforming into a powerful beast, then trying a new beast with different strengths and weaknesses, and then finally facing the party in its true form.
Be sure to add the XP of each beast the druid transformed into to the total XP of the encounter.

items.name: Change Shape (2/Day)
entries: The archdruid magically polymorphs into a beast with a challenge rating of 6 or less, and can remain in this form for up to 9 hours. The archdruid can choose whether its equipment falls to the ground, melds with its new form, or is worn by the new form. The archdruid reverts to its true form as a bonus action or if it is knocked to 0 hit points, with excess damage carrying over to its true form. While in a new form, the archdruid retains its game statistics, but its AC, movement modes, ability to speak, and Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any special senses, proficiencies, traits, actions, and reactions (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has. The new form's attacks are magical.

monster.name: Spore Spreader
languages: Druidic and Undercommon plus any one language

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The spore spreader is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared.

trait.name: Halo of Spores
entries: As a bonus action, the spore spreader can activate or deactivate its halo of spores. While activated, the spore spreader is surrounded by deadly fungal spores: creatures that start their turn within 10 feet of the spore spreader take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Servitude
entries: When the spore spreader reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the creature dies. If the body isn't destroyed, the creature returns to life in {@dice 1d4} hours as a spore servant.

action.name: Mushroom Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. This is a +1 magic weapon.

monster.name: Mercenary Spore Servant
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spore servant makes two attacks: one with its broken longsword, and one slam attack.

action.name: Broken Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: King Spore Servant
languages: understands all languages but can't speak

trait.name: Glamoured Breastplate
entries: Through illusion magic, the spore servant's breastplate is glamoured to take on the appearance of robes befitting royalty.

trait.name: Helm of Comprehending Languages
entries: The spore servant can understand all languages due to the residual energy from this magic item.

trait.name: Medallion of Thoughts
entries: The spore servant can't benefit from this magic item.

trait.name: Ring of Mind Shielding
entries: The spore servant cannot be telepathically communicated with. The ring is {@condition invisible}.

trait.name: Rod of Rulership
entries: The spore servan't can't benefit from the effects of this magic item, but it can still make attacks with it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spore servant makes two attacks: one with its greatsword, and one with its rod of rulership.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage. This is a +3 magic weapon. The spore servant wields this weapon with one hand and has disadvantage on attack rolls it makes with it.

action.name: Rod of Rulership
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Starmap Spellcasting
headerEntries: The starmapper can cast spells through its starmap. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells without material components.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The starmapper is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared.

action.name: Constellation Chalice (Star Being Form Only)
entries: The starmapper touches a creature. The target regains 8 ({@dice 1d8 + 4}) hit points.

action.name: Star Being (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The starmapper shapeshifts into a star being, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. While in its star being form, the starmapper sheds bright light for 10 feet and dim light 10 feet beyond that. The starmapper can remain in its star being form for up to 10 minutes.

reaction.name: Cosmic Omen
entries: When a creature the starmapper can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check, it can impose disadvantage on the roll.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mendicant's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared, which it can cast without material components.

trait.name: Aura of the Threshold
entries: Allied creatures within 30 feet of the mendicant have advantage on death saving throws.

trait.name: Death Speech
entries: When the mendicant converses with undead or dead humanoids, it can communicate as if they share a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mendicant makes two attacks with its Harvest's Scythe.

action.name: Harvest's Scythe
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) force damage, and the mendicant regains 5 hit points. If the target is undead, the mendicant regains 10 hit points instead.

trait.name: Action Surge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The indefatigable can take one additional action on its turn.

trait.name: Disarming Attack (1/Turn)
entries: When the indefatigable hits a creature with a melee attack, it can deal an additional 6 ({@damage 1d12}) damage and force the target to succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or drop a weapon or object of the indefatigable's choice that it is holding.

trait.name: Duelist
entries: As a bonus action, the indefatigable can force one creature it can see within 30 feet of it to make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls made against creatures other than the indefatigable and can't willingly move further away from it. These effects end at the start of the indefatigable's next turn.
Additionally, the indefatigable gains a +2 to damage rolls when it hits with its legendary longsword when wielded with one hand (included in the attack).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: When the indefatigable fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Armor
entries: The indefatigable's plate mail and shield are both magical, contributing to a +3 increase in AC each while the indefatigable wears them.

trait.name: Superior Critical
entries: The indefatigable scores a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

trait.name: Survivor
entries: The indefatigable regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Weapon Bond
entries: The indefatigable can summon its legendary longsword to its hand or banish it to a demiplane as a bonus action. The indefatigable can't be disarmed of this weapon unless it is {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The indefatigable makes four attacks with its legendary longsword.

action.name: Legendary Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d8 + 10}) slashing damage or 13 ({@damage 1d10 + 8}) slashing damage if wielded with two hands. This is a +3 magic weapon.

trait.name: Adamantine Armor
entries: Critical hits against the banneret become regular hits.

trait.name: Inspiring Surge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: After taking an action on its turn, the banneret can take one additional action. When it does so, it can also choose up to two friendly creatures within 60 feet of it that can see and hear the banneret. A target can immediately use its reaction to make one melee or ranged weapon attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The banneret makes two melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Banner
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Rallying Cry {@recharge 5}
entries: The banneret and up to three creatures within 60 feet of it that can hear it gain 10 temporary hit points.

trait.name: Action Surge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: After taking an action on its turn, the master-at-arms can take one additional action.

trait.name: Maneuvers (1/Turn)
entries: When the master-at-arms hits with a melee weapon attack, it can choose to apply a maneuver to that attack. The attack deals an additional 5 ({@damage 1d10}) damage, and the master-at-arms chooses one of the following effects.

trait.name: Disarming Attack
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or drop an object it is holding of the master-at-arms's choice. The object lands at its feet.

trait.name: Distracting Strike
entries: The next attack roll against the target by an attacker other than the master-at-arms has advantage if that attack is made before the start of the master-at-arms's next turn.

trait.name: Trip Attack
entries: If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The master-at-arms makes three melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Longsword of Unnatural Strength
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack. This is a magic weapon. While attuned to this sword, the wielder's Strengh is increased by 2, potentially above the maximum of 20.

variant.name: Battlemaster Maneuvers
entries: You can give battlemaster maneuvers to any fighter or any NPC that relies on physical weapons. When giving an NPC a maneuver, remember that save DC is calculated as proficiency bonus plus 8 plus modifier.
Don't forget that, for NPCs, proficiency is tied to challenge rating, not class level. Check the DMG guide (pgs. 274-282).

items.name: Commander's Strike {@recharge 5}.
items.entry: As a bonus action, the battlemaster chooses one friendly creature within 30 feet of it that can see and hear it. That creature can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack.

items.name: Disarming Strike (1/Turn).
items.entry: When the battlemaster hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC battlemaster's Strength). On a failed save, the target drops the object, which lands at its feet.

items.name: Feint.
items.entry: As a bonus action, the battlemaster targets one creature within 5 feet of it. The battlemaster has advantage on its next attack roll against that creature before the end of the battlemaster's turn.

items.name: Goading Strike (1/Turn).
items.entry: When the battlemaster hits a creature with a weapon attack, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC battlemaster's Strength) or incur disadvantage on all attack rolls against targets other than the battlemaster until the end of the battlemaster's next turn.

items.name: Lunge (1/Turn).
items.entry: The battlemaster extends the reach of its melee weapon attack by 5 feet.

items.name: Maneuver.
items.entry: The battlemaster commands a friendly creature within 30 feet of it that can see and hear it to immediately use its reaction to move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

items.name: Menacing Strike (1/Turn).
items.entry: When the battlemaster hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC battlemaster's Strength) or become frightened of the battlemaster until the end of the battlemaster's next turn.

items.name: Parry (Reaction).
items.entry: The battlemaster adds its proficiency bonus to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the battlemaster must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

items.name: Pushing Strike (1/Turn).
items.entry: When the battlemaster hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC battlemaster's Strength) or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the battlemaster.

items.name: Rally {@recharge 5}.
items.entry: As a bonus action, the battlemaster chooses up to 3 friendly creatures within 30 feet of it that can see and hear it. Each target gains 5 ({@dice 1d6 + 2}) temporary hit points.

items.name: Riposte (Reaction).
items.entry: When a creature misses the battlemaster with a melee attack, the battlemaster makes a melee weapon attack against the attacker.

items.name: Cleave (1/Turn).
items.entry: When the battlemaster hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the target can choose another creature within 5 feet of the original target. The battlemaster makes an additional attack against the new target.

items.name: Tripping Strike (1/Turn).
items.entry: When the battlemaster hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC battlemaster's Strength) or fall prone.

trait.name: Rally
entries: As a bonus action, the rally guard chooses a friendly creature within 30 feet of it that can see and hear it. The target gains 5 temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rally guard makes two melee weapon attacks, or it makes one melee weapon attack and uses its Commander's Strike.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Commander's Strike
entries: The rally guard chooses one friendly creature within 30 feet of it that can see and hear it. That creature can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack, adding 4 ({@dice 1d8}) to the attack's damage roll.

reaction.name: Protection
entries: When a creature attacks a target other than the rally guard within 30 feet of the rally guard, and the rally guard can see them both, the rally guard can move up to its speed. If it ends this movement within 5 feet of the target of the attack, the rally guard can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

variant.name: Battlemaster Maneuvers
entries: You can give battlemaster maneuvers to any fighter or any NPC that relies on physical weapons. When giving an NPC a maneuver, remember that save DC is calculated as proficiency bonus plus 8 plus modifier.
Don't forget that, for NPCs, proficiency is tied to challenge rating, not class level. Check the DMG guide (pgs. 274-282).

items.entry: As a bonus action, the battlemaster chooses one friendly creature within 30 feet of it that can see and hear it. That creature can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack.

items.name: Disarming Strike (1/Turn).
items.entry: When the battlemaster hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC battlemaster's Strength). On a failed save, the target drops the object, which lands at its feet.

items.name: Feint.

items.entry: The battlemaster extends the reach of its melee weapon attack by 5 feet.

items.name: Maneuver.
items.entry: The battlemaster commands a friendly creature within 30 feet of it that can see and hear it to immediately use its reaction to move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

items.name: Menacing Strike (1/Turn).
items.entry: When the battlemaster hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC battlemaster's Strength) or become frightened of the battlemaster until the end of the battlemaster's next turn.

items.entry: The battlemaster adds its proficiency bonus to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the battlemaster must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

items.name: Pushing Strike (1/Turn).
items.entry: When the battlemaster hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC battlemaster's Strength) or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the battlemaster.
